column5: Hi Paul,  Many thanks for the kind welcome and great to meet you.  I intend to stick around, this site is awesome with loads of helpful anglers giving advice.  Colin.
Hi,  Great to meet you and thanks for the kind welcome.  Colin.
Hi GBW,  Great to meet you and many thanks for the kind welcome.  Also many thanks for the link, I will certainly follow it up and give it a look.  Hope to speak again soon.  Colin.
Hi Dusky,  Great to meet you and many thanks for the kind welcome.  Colin.

Hi,  Many thanks for the warm welcome and its great to meet you.  Will post some more pics of the cats and carp over the weekend.  Your right, Carp especially are fished for heavily in Europe as well as the Cats where as over here its totally the reverse. I'm looking forward to getting in to some Bass, Pike, Walleye, Trout and Salmon as and when I can.  Colin.
Hi Chris,  Many thanks for your kind welcome and its great to meet you.  Colin.
Hi Afraz,  Great to meet you and thanks for the kind welcome.  Looking forward to getting out and finding some waters in my area.  Colin.

Welcome Colin, we live not too far from you in Richmond Hill.  The closest places that we fish are Lake Simcoe or Lake Ontario.  The Kawartha's are not too far east either.  We're not much into the cat or carp fishing but there are alot of members who are and I'm sure you'll get all the info you need from them.  Welcome to Canada and welcome aboard,  Joey

Wow its true ...the limeys are so polite...   no wonder the cops over there dont need guns  "please stop robbing that bank" Just kidding around man ...welcome to this country we call home ...your going to love it ! ....  Welcome to the board ! your going to have a new addiction  Cheers!

Hi Mike,  Great to meet you and thanks for the warm welcome.  I'm always looking for new waters whether they are near or far so will certainly give you a shout if I'm out that way, many thanks for the offer.  Colin.

Hi Tony,  Great to meet you and thanks for the nice welcome.  I've been looking around over the weekend and took a look at the Grand River, found it very shallow and for the most part only good for fly fishing, also took a look at Lake Guelph which seems very promising, deep water close in so hopefully might get some fishing in there over the next few weeks if I can find out if it's worth it.  Colin.
Hey Mate,  Great to meet you, the politeness only  lasts until the first reply so from now on it's all downhill....  Hope to catch up soon and discuss fishing.  Colin.
Welcome Aboard, sign up for the OFC Tourney we are looking for 4 more people for the next Draw Tight Lines SBK
Welcome aboard Colin, nice to have another "limey" around....look forward to your fish tales.

Hey Colin. Welcome to Canada and more specifically to Vaughan. Being a fellow resident, I can tell you that there many good lakes within a couple of hours drive or less offering a wide variety of species. There is good action in both the soft water and hard water seasons on Lake Simcoe which is less than an hour from you.  Shoot me a PM if you want more details.  Tony
Welcome to OFC Colin Looking forward to reading your fishing adventures!!! Leechman
Welcome aboard!  If I knew you were coming I would have got you to bring some of those really tiny Mepps Syclops that they only make available in Europe   Look forward to sharing conversation.

If you ever look at this post again, Welcome! Easiest way to start fishing around here is to get a cheap, medium spinning rod put some 8  lb mono on it, a simple sinker, hook with a worm and throw it out there. There is a excellent variety of fish most lakes or river that will hit that worm.
It's gonna be a while before you catch a 50lb carp in Canada, but you'll catch 20 x 20lb carp in a day soon. (that's 8 times more weight anyway). Welcome to Canada.
Welcome to the board.  I moved to Canada a few years ago now and everyone here will make you feel welcome.  Some great people here that are a blast to fish with
Hi Hud,  Many thanks for the kind welcome and I'm so looking forward to getting down to the river or lake and wetting a line.  Hope to speak again soon.  Colin.

Hi Billy Bob,  Great to meet you and thanks for the tip off, I'll make sure I don't fall in to their trap apart from the bit about beer...  Cant wait to get down to a river or lake and wet a line.  Hope to speak again very soon.......eh..!!  Colin.

Hey BITEME,  Great to meet you and thanks for the kind welcome, would be great to catch up and fish sometime, whenever your free just message me and we can make it happen.  Hope to speak soon.  Colin.
Hi John,  Great to meet you and thanks for the warm welcome.  Would be great to chat anytime you like about fishing.  Colin.

Hi Mike,  Great to meet you and many thanks for the advice, I will certainly take a drive up and see whats around.  We took a drive up to Georgian Bay a few weekends ago and some of the waters where amazing.  Hope to catch up soon.  Colin.

Hi Roy,  Many thanks for the warm welcome.  From the feed back I have already had from this site makes me feel that the members are true helpful fishermen and women with the best interests of the sport at heart.  I look forward to a long and interesting membership and will certainly be as helpful as the others have been in any fishing ventures I go on.  Colin.
Hi,  Many thanks for the warm welcome.  I will certainly sign up in the next few days.  Looking forward to being a long standing helpful member.  Colin.
Hi,  Many thanks for the warm welcome.  Looking forward to posting lots of fish tales in the future....  Colin.
Hi,  Great to meet you and thanks for the warm welcome.  I hope the Carp gurus will chip in as well as all the other anglers that fish for different species.  Colin.

Hi,  Many thanks for the warm welcome and great to meet you.  I'm looking forward to getting as much help as I can as well as going out and searching for myself, to be honest distance doesn't bother me with regards to fishing and I feel that you only get out what you put in and if that means travelling long distances then I really don't mind.  I took a drive up to Georgian Bay the other weekend and was overawed by the immense size of some of the waters up there, watercraft is certainly going to play a big part in finding the fish.  Hope to speak again soon.  Colin.
Hi,  Many thanks for the warm welcome and great to meet you.  Looking forward to swapping posts on fishing stories in the very near future.  Colin.
Hi,  Great to meet you and thanks for the warm welcome.  Unfortunately I didn't have much room left in my bags along with the fishing gear...  Colin.
Hi,  Great to meet you and thanks for the warm welcome.....eh...!!!  Colin.

Hi,  Nice to meet you and thanks for the kind welcome.  Regarding the catfish, once the first few heavy runs are over it's just a matter of coaxing them in gently with lots of heavy head thumps, the first few runs are amazing and its just a matter of hanging on while they empty the spool of line.....all heart thumping action.  Looking forward to wetting a line soon over here.  Colin.

Hi,  Great to meet you and many thanks for the warm welcome.  Thanks for the advice, I took a drive up to Lake Simcoe the other weekend and was overawed by the immense size of the water, its certainly going to be a challenge to find where the fish are, but watercraft is as important as the fishing itself, so looking forward to it.  I'm not looking specifically for Carp, I'm looking to catch my first Large or Smallmouth Bass as well as Salmon and Steelhead.  Hope to speak again very soon.  Colin.

Hi,  Many thanks for the kind welcome and its great to meet you.  I was down at the Niagra Whirlpool last weekend and took a walk around, I heard that you can fish for Steelhead at the Whirlpool but found access very difficult.  Would be great to get out anytime, just drop me a line here.  Colin.
Hi Paul,  Many thanks for the kind welcome and great to meet you.  I intend to stick around, this site is awesome with loads of helpful anglers giving advice.  Colin.

Hi Everyone,   I've just joined this forum site and must say the initial impression is very good, lots of people willing to help other fellow fishermen on venues, topics and tactics.  I'm new to Canada, living in the Vaughan area of Woodbridge, I've fished mainly in Europe in the large English, French and Spanish rivers and lakes with captures including Catfish to 136 lbs and Carp to 52 lbs, although I get just as much fun getting my string pulled by Pike, Walleye, Bass and anything else that swims by.  To me fishing is a great pleasure just by being by the water and catching something is a bonus. I don't mind travelling long distances to fish, but to start with any information on waters close to home that might put a bend in my rod would be much appreciated.  Likewise I'm more than willing to pass on any information or tips on tackle and methods to anyone intending to fish over in Europe.  Tight lines to you all and hope to speak again soon.  Colin.
Welcome aboard Im sure the carp gurus will chime in
Welcome to the board Colin. I am sure you will get lots of coaching for  places to start fishing real soon. I would give you some advice but you see I am a little South of you.    Art
Welcome to OFC and Canada!
Welcome aboard !!! Did you bring any 3X or Bountiful with you to share???
welcome to Canada , eh.... and welcome to OFC
welcome  - I think anyone who can catch fish that size probably has some very transferable skills, and will meet with success here. So, just how long does it take to land a 136 lb catfish I wonder?

Hey Colin! Welcome to OFC and to Canada as well!  You are within a very short drive to some great areas for fishing. Lake Simcoe is virtually an inland great lake and has all kinds of opportunities. This amazing body of water is just up the 400 Highway from you. As mentioned already, if it is Carp you are interested in, the experts will be along shortly to give you specific info.  There are lots of good rivers and streams as well.  Enjoy your time on the board!
Welcome Colin, to Canada and OFC!  If you get down to the Niagara region drop me a line and I'll get you out for Salmon or Bass...Or Muskie.
Welcome to OFC and Canada Dude ! Hope ya stick around !  Paul
Welcome
welcome to the site and Canada  This could help but keep in mind the info isn't 100% by any means. http://www.web2.mnr.gov.on.ca/fish_online/fishing/fishingExplorer_en.html
Welcome aboard!

welcome dude, would love to see some pics of your catches if available. It's funny how carp and cats are the primary target over there while pike, walleye and bass are secondary. Quite the opposite here. You should have no problem finding good carp fishing or fishing in general in your area. Best of luck
Welcome aboard Colin
Welcome, lots of good fishing to be had near your area.

Hi Catfish:  Welcome to the site.  You will find that you have moved into fishing paradise. We are surrounded by amazing fisheries and there are hundreds of lakes all within a 2 hour drive of you. To the north of you is Lake Simcoe which is a big waterbody that holds some great fish. East will land you in the Kawartha's with numerous productive lakes. Try Rice Lake for great numbers of multiple species, including non-stop carp action if your interested. Pigeon, Chemong, Scugog, Balsam, etc. We tend to get spoiled living here and forget all the great fishing we have right at our doorstep. If you want to try for some trout and salmon, the numerous creeks and rivers that enter Lake Ontario are nearby and easy to fish. Niagra Falls isn't just for looking at it offers dynamite fishing in the area.  If you like big rivers, check out the St. Lawerence east of Kingston, lots of action and area to fish.   Have fun but keep us posted around here because most of us like hearing about and sharing good fishing.
Do yourself a favor and come to long sault in the st. Lawrence river... Loads of carp and big ones too
Welcome

Welcome aboard Colin as others have said welcome to Canada also. You have alot of great fishing in your backyard and as others have said the locals will get you out for sure.  If your ever heading down to the Chatham (between London and Windsor) area please drop me a line we might be able to get out for some fishing on Lake St.Clair.  Cheers

Catfish 136.....  Don't trust these Canadians......I'm warning you....before you know it they will lure you in and you will be drinking their COLD Canadian Beer in no time....then they will have you arguing about hockey.....and finally you will be looking like this...   and ending every sentence with...eh...  Welcome, A Canadian Redneck Cousin, Bob
I hook you up on the lake if your out in Bronte way sometime  Welcome
Hi Colin, welcome aboard! Nice to hear from other fellow Brits in Canada. Drop me a PM sometime, would like to chat about those Spanish Cats!

If you get the opportunity, take a little drive up to North Bay.  Lake Nipissing has some excellent fishing for almost anything that swims(except trout).  It's only a 3.5 hour drive from you and there are numerous places to stay.  Most of the lodges and cottages up here include a boat rental but you will need to get a pleasure craft operators card.  There are several OFC members up this way so i doubt you'd have a problem finding a fishing buddy
Welcome to our community, Colin. Looking forward to your input here.
